New Records: Lionel Messi broke the record for most minutes played in the tournament's history.
Key Match Events: Lisandro Martínez scored the opener for Argentina in the 35th minute.
Kevin Rodríguez equalized for Ecuador in stoppage time (91st minute).
Emiliano Martínez made two key saves in the penalty shootout.
Nicolás Otamendi scored the decisive penalty kick to secure Argentina's semifinal spot.
Pre-Game Insights: Lionel Messi started the game despite being an injury doubt after missing their final group match against Peru due to a hamstring issue.
Post-Match Reflections: Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni emphasized the team's confidence in their goalkeeper, Emi Martinez, especially after Lionel Messi's missed penalty.
Scaloni mentioned that winning in this manner was not enjoyable despite the happiness of advancing.
Ecuador coach Felix Sanchez reflected on Enner Valencia's missed penalty, acknowledging his confidence and contribution in other areas of the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at NRG Stadium in Houston, Texas, with an attendance of 69,456 spectators.
